citeinfo.title: UTA Routes and Most Recent Ridership

descript.abstract:
Feature Layer includes all routes for bus, Light Rail (TRAX), Streetcar (S Line) and Commuter Rail (Frontrunner). Includes: Route Number, route name, frequency in minutes, route type, average weekday ridership, and all cities and counties the route services.
Routes are updated 3 times a year (typically April, August, and December).
Weekday ridership values (AvgBrd) are updated monthly after the 10th of the following month.
descript.purpose: Utah Transit Authority Routes - including bus and rail - as of April 14, 2024 Change Day.

idinfo.useconst: Published data made available in the UTA Open Data Portal is a public service to enhance open government, transparency, and accountability. All data is made available on an “as is” basis. All data that has been published on the Open Data Portal has been determined to be public data. Although UTA strives to ensure that such published data are accurate, UTA shall make no warranty, representation or guaranty of any type as to the content, accuracy, timeliness, completeness or fitness for any particular purpose or use of any published data provided on such portal; nor shall any such warranty be implied, including, without limitation, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. UTA shall assume no liability for:any errors, omissions or inaccuracies in the data provided on the UTA Open Data Portal regardless of how caused;any decision made or action taken or not taken by anyone using or relying upon such data;any other act identified in any disclaimer of liability or indemnification provisionUTA shall reserve the right to discontinue availability of content on the UTA Open Data Portal at any time and for any reason. If UTA learns that any dataset or portion thereof posted on the data portal is factually inaccurate or misleading or is protected data, UTA will correct or remove such data from the UTA Open Data Portal without prior notice.
